API Reference¶

This section is generated from docstrings across the application codebase.

Accounts¶

Models for tracking user contributions, trust levels, and moderation impacts.

class accounts.models.Contribution(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: Model

Track contribution counts, points, and trust levels for a user.

Parameters:

  • user – The user this contribution record belongs to.

  • places_added – Count of approved place submissions by the user.

  • reviews_added – Count of reviews posted by the user.

  • points – Total contribution points accumulated by the user.

  • upheld_reports_count – Count of upheld reports against the user’s reviews.

  • review_restriction_active – Flag indicating if the user is blocked from posting reviews.

is_trusted()¶

Return True if the user’s points meet the trusted threshold.

Returns:

True when points are at or above TRUSTED_THRESHOLD.

Return type:

bool

property level_name¶

Return the display name for the user’s current contribution level.

Returns:

The current level name based on points.

Return type:

str

property level_badge_class¶

Return the Bootstrap badge class for the user’s current level.

Returns:

The badge class string.

Return type:

str

property next_level_name¶

Return the next level name the user is working toward.

Returns:

The next level name or None if already at top level.

Return type:

str | None

property points_to_next_level¶

Return the number of points required to reach the next level.

Returns:

Points remaining to next level, or 0 if at top level.

Return type:

int

property level_progress_percent¶

Return the user’s progress toward the next level as a percentage.

Returns:

Progress percentage from 0 to 100.

Return type:

int

exception DoesNotExist¶

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

Views for account authentication, activation, profile, and account management.

accounts.views.login_view(request)¶

Sign in an existing user account.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – Incoming HTTP request containing optional POST credentials.

Returns:

Rendered login page or redirect on successful authentication.

Return type:

HttpResponse

accounts.views.activate_account(request, uidb64, token)¶

Activate a newly created account using a time-limited token link.

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) – Incoming HTTP request.

  • uidb64 (str) – Base64 encoded user ID.

  • token (str) – Activation token issued at signup.

Returns:

Redirect to login with a success or error message.

Return type:

HttpResponse

accounts.views.signup_view(request)¶

Create an inactive account and email an activation link.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – Incoming HTTP request with signup form data.

Returns:

Rendered signup form on validation errors or redirect to login on success.

Return type:

HttpResponse

accounts.views.logout_view(request)¶

Log out the current user.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – Incoming HTTP request.

Returns:

Redirect to home page after logout.

Return type:

HttpResponse

accounts.views.profile_view(request)¶

Show profile details, contribution stats, and moderation outcomes.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – Incoming HTTP request for an authenticated user.

Returns:

Rendered profile page with contribution and submission data.

Return type:

HttpResponse

accounts.views.contributions_view(request)¶

Render detailed contribution stats page.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – Incoming HTTP request for an authenticated user.

Returns:

Rendered contributions summary page.

Return type:

HttpResponse

accounts.views.delete_account(request)¶

Allow users to permanently delete their own account.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – Incoming HTTP request, must be POST to delete.

Returns:

Rendered confirmation page or redirect after deletion.

Return type:

HttpResponse

Signal handlers for contribution tracking.

accounts.signals.create_contribution(sender, instance, created, **kwargs)¶

Create a Contribution record when a new user is created.

Parameters:

  • sender – The model class sending the signal.

  • instance – The newly created User instance.

  • created – True if the user was created in this save.

  • kwargs – Additional signal keyword arguments.

Returns:

None

accounts.signals.award_points_for_review(sender, instance, created, **kwargs)¶

Award contribution points when a user posts a review.

Parameters:

  • sender – The Review model class.

  • instance – The Review instance that was saved.

  • created – True if the review was created in this save.

  • kwargs – Additional signal keyword arguments.

Returns:

None

accounts.signals.award_points_for_place(sender, instance, created, **kwargs)¶

Award contribution points when a user submits a place.

Parameters:

  • sender – The Place model class.

  • instance – The Place instance that was saved.

  • created – True if the place was created in this save.

  • kwargs – Additional signal keyword arguments.

Returns:

None

Places¶

Models for places, place types, images, and likes.

class places.models.Place(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: PolymorphicModel

Base model for all place types with shared attributes and moderation fields.

class Category(*values)¶

Bases: TextChoices

class ModerationStatus(*values)¶

Bases: TextChoices

property likes_count¶

Return the total number of likes for this place.

Returns:

Count of PlaceLike records.

Return type:

int

property average_rating¶

Return the rounded average rating for this place.

Returns:

Average rating rounded to two decimals, or None if no reviews.

Return type:

float | None

property has_opening_hours¶

Return True when both opening and closing times are set.

Returns:

True if opening hours are present.

Return type:

bool

property supports_opening_hours¶

Return True if opening hours are applicable for this place type.

Returns:

False for beaches, True otherwise.

Return type:

bool

property opening_days_display¶

Return a human-readable display of opening days.

Returns:

Display string such as ‘Mon, Wed, Fri’ or ‘Daily’.

Return type:

str

property is_open_now¶

Return whether the place is open at the current time.

Returns:

True if open now, False if closed, None if not applicable.

Return type:

bool | None

save(*args, **kwargs)¶

Save the place and synchronize is_approved from moderation_status.

Parameters:

  • args – Positional arguments forwarded to Model.save.

  • kwargs – Keyword arguments forwarded to Model.save.

Returns:

None

Forms for creating and editing places and their opening hours.

class places.forms.PlaceForm(data=None, files=None, auto_id='id_%s', prefix=None, initial=None, error_class=<class 'django.forms.utils.ErrorList'>, label_suffix=None, empty_permitted=False, instance=None, use_required_attribute=None, renderer=None)¶

Bases: ModelForm

Base form for creating a Place with shared fields and opening hours.

clean()¶

Validate place submission, including location and opening hours rules.

Returns:

Cleaned form data with normalized opening hour fields.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

forms.ValidationError – If location data or hours are incomplete.

property media¶

Return all media required to render the widgets on this form.

class places.forms.PlaceOpeningHoursForm(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: ModelForm

clean()¶

Returns:

Cleaned form data with opening hour fields normalized.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

forms.ValidationError – If one time is missing.

save(commit=True)¶

Parameters:

Returns:

Updated Place instance.

Return type:

Place

  • pk (int) – Place primary key.

Returns:

JSON response for AJAX or redirect for standard requests.

Return type:

HttpResponse

  • pk (int) – Place primary key.

Utility helpers for place-related services.

places.utils.geocode_location(location_text)¶

Convert postcode or address into latitude and longitude using postcodes.io.

Parameters:

location_text – Postcode or address string.

Returns:

Tuple of (latitude, longitude) or (None, None) if lookup fails.

Return type:

tuple[float | None, float | None]

Bases: ModelForm

Parameters:

  • require_captcha (bool)

  • captcha_question (str)

clean_honeypot()¶

Validate the hidden honeypot field to detect bots.

Returns:

Empty string when no spam detected.

Return type:

str

Raises:

forms.ValidationError – If the honeypot field is filled.

Return all media required to render the widgets on this form.

Anti-spam helpers for review submissions.

reviews.spam.normalize_text(text)¶

Normalize text for similarity comparison.

Parameters:

text (str) – Raw review text input.

Returns:

Normalized text with punctuation removed and whitespace collapsed.

Return type:

str

reviews.spam.get_or_create_captcha(request)¶

Return the current CAPTCHA requirement and question for the session.

Parameters:

request – Incoming HTTP request.

Returns:

Tuple of (required flag, question text).

Return type:

tuple[bool, str]

reviews.spam.require_captcha(request)¶

Flag the session so CAPTCHA is required on the next submission.

Parameters:

request – Incoming HTTP request.

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

reviews.spam.validate_captcha(request, submitted_answer)¶

Validate a submitted CAPTCHA answer and clear the requirement on success.

Parameters:

  • request – Incoming HTTP request.

  • submitted_answer (str) – User’s answer to the CAPTCHA question.

Returns:

True if the answer matches the expected value.

Return type:

bool

reviews.spam.is_duplicate_or_similar_review(place, text)¶

Check whether a review is a duplicate or too similar for a given place.

Parameters:

  • place – Place instance to compare against.

  • text (str) – Review text to evaluate.

Returns:

True if duplicate or highly similar review is detected.

Return type:

bool

Shared moderation helpers for logging admin actions.

reviews.moderation.log_moderation_action(*, actor, action, target, notes='')¶

Create a moderation log entry for the given action and target.

Parameters:

  • actor – User performing the action.

  • action (str) – Action enum value from ModerationLog.Action.

  • target – Model instance being moderated.

  • notes (str) – Optional free-text notes for audit context.

Returns:

None

Return type:

None
